macro_events.resolution_criteria: NBER announces recession or two consecutive quarters negative GDP (Q2 2025-Q4 2026), by Q4 2026 advance estimate release
macro_events.mu_relevance: high - recession would severely cut DRAM/NAND demand from enterprise and consumer segments

macro_events.note: Kalshi recession odds fell to 25% from 42% in July 2025, after strong Q3 GDP of 4.3%

macro_events.resolution_criteria: Full year 2026 GDP advance estimate below 0% (BEA)
macro_events.mu_relevance: medium - negative GDP = cyclical downturn for memory demand

macro_events.resolution_criteria: CPI increases by more than 3% over any 12-month period ending in 2026 (BLS)
macro_events.mu_relevance: medium - high inflation may delay rate cuts, raising discount rates and pressuring tech valuations
medium - rate hike would be bearish for capital-intensive memory industry capex cycle

company_specific.event: Will Micron Technology (MU) beat quarterly earnings (non-GAAP EPS > $3.78, Dec 17 2025 report)
company_specific.note: Historical market - MU Dec 2025 earnings. No active forward-looking MU-specific markets found as of 2026-02-08
company_specific.mu_relevance: informational - shows Polymarket has covered MU earnings but no active market currently

industry_events.resolution_criteria: At least 3 of: NVDA -50% from ATH, SOXX -40% from ATH, OpenAI/Anthropic bankruptcy, OpenAI acquired, H100 rental <= $1.00 for 5 consecutive days — within 90-day window
industry_events.mu_relevance: critical - MU is major HBM3E supplier to AI accelerators; AI downturn = HBM demand collapse
low near-term risk - only 4% probability of imminent AI bust

industry_events.event: China invades Taiwan by end of 2026
industry_events.mu_relevance: critical - Taiwan invasion = TSMC production halt = severe supply chain disruption for advanced packaging; MU benefits as non-Taiwan supplier but overall industry chaos
low near-term risk of Taiwan invasion

industry_events.resolution_criteria: Any incident involving use of force (missile strikes, artillery, gunfire, direct military engagement) between Chinese and Taiwanese forces, Nov 2025-Dec 2026
industry_events.mu_relevance: high - military clash short of invasion still causes supply chain panic and semiconductor risk premium

industry_events.resolution_criteria: China establishes aerial or naval blockade for Taiwan territory by June 30, 2026
industry_events.mu_relevance: medium - blockade would disrupt TSMC supply chain, boost MU as alternative but create industry chaos

industry_events.event: Supreme Court rules in favor of Trump's tariffs
industry_events.mu_relevance: medium - tariff escalation could impact semiconductor supply chains and pricing

fed_rate_outlook.kalshi_march_cut_note: Kalshi shows 64% probability of March cut — significant divergence from Polymarket's 16%
fed_rate_outlook.mu_relevance: high - rate cuts lower discount rates, reduce MU's debt servicing cost (~$11B long-term debt), and support memory cycle recovery

no_coverage: DRAM/memory specific prediction markets — searched 'site:polymarket.com DRAM memory', zero results
Chip export ban specific prediction markets — searched 'site:polymarket.com chip export ban', no dedicated market found
Semiconductor tariff on Kalshi — searched 'site:kalshi.com semiconductor tariff', no dedicated market found
MU-specific forward-looking markets — only expired Dec 2025 earnings market found
HBM demand/pricing prediction markets — no coverage on any platform
Memory cycle prediction markets — no coverage on any platform
key_implications_for_mu: 1) RECESSION RISK MODERATE: 25-26% probability (Polymarket+Kalshi consensus) — MU is highly cyclical, recession = memory ASP decline. 2) AI BUBBLE LOW-MEDIUM: 22% probability of AI downturn by end 2026, only 4% by March — MU's HBM3E revenue growth story has ~78% probability of remaining intact through 2026. 3) TAIWAN RISK MANAGEABLE: 12% invasion, 16% military clash, 6% blockade — MU as US-based memory maker could be relative beneficiary vs Taiwan-exposed competitors (Nanya, Winbond) but overall industry disruption is net negative. 4) FED CUTS SUPPORTIVE: 53% probability of 2-3 cuts, only 7% chance of zero cuts — favorable for capital-intensive memory sector. 5) INFLATION WATCH: 30% chance of >3% inflation could delay cuts. 6) NO MEMORY-SPECIFIC MARKETS: Prediction markets have zero coverage of DRAM/NAND/HBM cycles, limiting direct applicability.

comparison_vs_tsm_report.blockade_june2026: 6% (TSM report had 9% — different timeframe or updated)
comparison_vs_tsm_report.us_recession_2026: 26% (TSM report had 20% — notable increase, +6pp from Polymarket; Kalshi at 25%)
